business.headline: ITR on hold? Tax department issues clarification on 'risk management' alertsThe tax department's latest clarification aims to ease taxpayer anxiety, stressing that the alerts are advisory and encourage voluntary correction. Refunds will resume once discrepancies are fixed or claims are verified as genuine.
Coca-Cola India bottler HCCB announces plan to lay off 300 workersHindustan Coca-Cola Beverages (HCCB) currently has around 5,000 employees across India and operates 15 manufacturing units.

Gujarat Kidney IPO closes today: Should you subscribe? Here's what GMP suggestsGujarat Kidney IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 250.80 crore. The entire issue is a fresh issue of 2.20 crore equity shares, with no offer for sale component. This means all the money raised through the IPO will go to the company.

Why some celebrity brands thrive while others fadeFrom Katrina Kaif's Kay Beauty to Kusha Kapila's Underneat, celebrity brands are no longer side projects. While some scale steadily and earn consumer trust, others struggle to outgrow launch buzz. What explains this divide?

Robin Raina denies Eraaya allegations, says 50% shareholding case is still openIn a statement released on December 23, 2025, Robin Raina said that Eraaya Lifespaces has been spreading incorrect information through repeated media statements

Planning to change jobs? Why you should not withdraw your PFA new job usually means better prospects and a fresh start. Yet, in the rush to move on, one costly mistake is common: withdrawing your PF. What feels like easy money today can hurt your long-term financial security.

Tax refund put on hold under risk management? What the message meansA sudden message from the income tax department has unsettled many taxpayers, who are unsure why their returns are under review. Here is all you need to know.
Sensex, Nifty give up early gains to end lower as investors book profitsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 42.64 points to close at 85,524.84, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 4.75 points to end at 26,177.15.

Buy now or wait? Why delaying a home purchase can cost you more than you expectIs waiting really the wiser choice for homebuyers, or can rising prices turn patience into a costly mistake? Let's break it down.

VRS or early retirement? Why your PF needs a new story for a new lifeVoluntary Retirement Schemes, or VRS, and early exits, once seen as dramatic decisions, have now become part of real conversations in many households.

Your bank says you need home loan insurance. But is it really mandatory?Banks often push insurance at the final stage of a home loan, leaving many borrowers unsure of what they must agree to. Is it actually mandatory to take that insurance?

IRFC shares jump 5%: Why is the railway stock rising today?Shares of Indian Railway Finance Corporation Ltd, also known as IRFC, have been rebounding after a long correction. The stock had touched a record high of Rs 229 in July last year.

8th Pay Commission: Will central government employees see salary hike in 2026?With the 7th Pay Commission ending in December 2025, are government employees now headed for a 20–35% salary hike under the 8th Pay Commission? Let's understand here.

Got a strict ITR mismatch message from the tax department? Here's what it meansThe communication has caused anxiety because of its wording, which tells taxpayers that not responding "may be construed as a deliberate choice" and that such cases may be taken up for detailed investigation.

How to build portfolios that survive market stormsMarket risk is far more visible than other risks on account of associated volatility, leading investors to confuse safety with low volatility. A stable investment can also quietly erode wealth if it fails to beat inflation or lacks liquidity.

Explained: Why Belrise Industries share price rose 13% todayBelrise stock: The share price moved higher after a large block deal took place and after the company announced a new strategic partnership in the defence space.
Why do your financial plans fail even when markets perform well?Strong markets should mean stable financial plans. So why do many plans fall apart? Here's what often goes wrong.

ITR refund put on hold? Here's what's actually going onThe growing wait for refunds has left taxpayers looking for answers, and the real question is what exactly has changed this year to make the process feel slower than most expected.

IRCTC out of F&O from February 2026. What it means for tradersWith IRCTC set to move out of the F&O segment next year, the real question now is how the stock will trade once derivatives dry up and only cash-market cues remain.

Is it too late to buy gold, silver as prices hit record high?With gold and silver smashing past every previous record, the question now is whether this rally still has fuel left, or if investors risk entering just as the momentum begins to fade.

entertainment.headline: Actor Ahn Bo-hyun tears up at Kim Woo-bin and Shin Min-a's wedding. See pic Pictures of South Korean actor Ahn Bo-hyun wiping away tears at Kim Woo-bin and Shin Min-a's wedding have gone viral, drawing widespread attention to the actors' long-standing friendship and the significance of the occasion.

Darshan's The Devil, Dileep's Bha Bha Ba: Why fan loyalty didn't assure hit status Two South Indian superstars released films amid serious controversies. Despite strong openings, Dileep's The Devil and Dileep's Bha Bha Ba struggled to maintain box office momentum, showing limits of fan loyalty.

Bharti Singh gets emotional after son Laksh checks on her at hospital. Watch Comedian Bharti Singh updated fans and followers on her recovery and newborn son through a YouTube vlog after giving birth.

45 review: An entertaining blend between metaphysical and physical worldsRelease Date:Thu Dec 25, 2025 45 movie review: This blend of worlds is entertaining and thought-provoking, but whether it gets too indulgent in what it is trying to say remains an afterthought in this multi-starrer Kannada film, 45, featuring Raj B Shetty caught between Shiva Rajkumar and Upendra.

Hrithik Roshan, sons Hrehaan and Hridhaan, own the floor at cousin's wedding. Watch Hrithik Roshan attended his cousin Eshaan Roshan's wedding celebrations accompanied by his sons Hrehaan and Hridhaan, where the trio was seen dancing together along with members of the Roshan family. The video went viral on social media.

After Dhurandhar's success, Akshaye Khanna steps away from Drishyam 3: Report Actor Akshaye Khanna has reportedly walked out of Drishyam 3 due to disagreements over remuneration and creative direction. The move comes after the success of his recent blockbuster film Dhurandhar.

How Shiva Rajkumar has been Kannada cinema's torch-bearer for multi-starrers Veteran Kannada actor Shiva Rajkumar has consistently featured in multi-starrers over the past decade. His upcoming film, 45, which also stars Upendra and Raj B Shetty, promises to be the biggest of them all.

JungKook of BTS unwraps a gentle homecoming with The Christmas Song cover JungKook has released a solo cover of The Christmas Song as a surprise gift for fans. This marks his first official release since returning from military service and signals a gentle lead-up to BTS's full-group comeback in 2026.

Dhurandhar: Rupali Ganguly's mother dances to Shararat, stuns Ayesha, Krystle A dance video featuring Rajani Ganguly, mother of Vijay Ganguly and Rupali Ganguly, has gone viral. Several celebrities, including Ayesha Khan, Krystle D Souza, and director Amar Kaushik have reacted to the post.

Upendra reacts to criticism on brief role in Coolie: I did it for Rajinikanth Kannada actor Upendra responded to criticisms about his brief role in Lokesh Kanagaraj's Coolie, expressing admiration and deep respect for Rajinikanth. The film, which features a star-studded cast, premiered in August.

Dhurandhar: Akshaye Khanna's brutal Rehman Dakait is also a sensitive lover Akshaye Khanna's Rehman Dakait in Dhurandhar is a ruthless villain drenched in blood and vengeance. But hidden beneath the gunshots and grief is a man with a quiet love story that makes him remarkable.

Dhurandhar box office Day 19: Ranveer's film beats Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2 in Hindi Aditya Dhar's film Dhurandhar, starring Ranveer Singh, continues its strong performance at the Indian box office. The film collected Rs 17.25 crore on Tuesday, according to early estimates. It has also beaten a previous record held by Allu Arjun's hit film Pushpa 2.

Inside Travis Kelce's letter calling Taylor Swift 'love of my life' A personal letter from Travis Kelce to Taylor Swift, featured in her docuseries Taylor Swift: The End of an Era, has become a viral sensation. It offers fans a rare look at the couple's relationship before the final Eras Tour shows.

Ali Fazal posts Mirzapur: The Film BTS, calls Rajasthan home Ali Fazal has shared a behind-the-scenes glimpse from the shoot of Mirzapur: The Film, currently underway in Rajasthan. The much-anticipated cinematic extension of the popular OTT series promises a grand theatrical release across India in 2026.

Homebound in legal heat as author alleges film copied 2021 novel, Dharma reacts Dharma Productions addressed plagiarism allegations related to the film Homebound through legal channels after author Puja Changoiwala accused them of copying her 2021 novel. The dispute arises as the film, India's official entry for the Oscars, continues its campaign.

Prakash Raj wraps key schedule for SS Rajamouli's Varanasi, posts update from set Actor Prakash Raj has completed an important shooting schedule of the much-anticipated film Varanasi, directed by SS Rajamouli. The film stars Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra Jonas, and Prithviraj Sukumaran, and is set for a grand release in 2027.

Pro Bono review: Jung Kyung-ho legal drama finds its voice in society's blind spotRelease Date:Sat Dec 06, 2025 Netflix's Korean legal drama Pro Bono explores themes of power, ambition, and justice through the fall and redemption of a high-profile judge who joins a pro bono legal team. It is streaming on Netflix.

Avengers: Doomsday teaser hints at Steve Rogers' new chapter. Watch here The first look at Avengers: Doomsday confirms Chris Evans' comeback. It also teases a multiversal conflict involving familiar Marvel characters, with the film set to arrive in cinemas in December 2026.

Hrithik Roshan dances to dhol beats at cousin's wedding, videos go viral Hrithik Roshan was seen dancing with family members during the baraat at his cousin's wedding, with videos from the celebrations circulating on social media. The actor attended the event with his sons, while other members of the Roshan family, including Rakesh Roshan, were also present.

general news.headline: Isro's Christmas triumph: LVM3 launched with heaviest foreign satelliteBlueBird Block-2, the largest commercial comms satellite for LEO to date, boasts a 223 sq m phased-array antenna to beam 4G/5G signals straight to unmodified smartphones.

Trump accused of rape in Epstein files, but DOJ rubbishes claimsThe US Justice Department has rejected as "untrue and sensationalist" an unverified rape allegation against Donald Trump found in newly released Jeffrey Epstein investigation files, stressing that Trump was never formally investigated.

Indian law student demolishes Pakistan in Oxford Union debateWhile Moosa Harraj, the Pakistani Oxford Union president, sabotaged a debate between Indian and Pakistani experts on terrorism, a students' version of the very same debate took place. Indian law student Viraansh Bhanushali destroyed Harraj by blending personal trauma and data, even as he exposed Pakistan's role in terrorism.

Not a luxury: Plea seeks medical device status for air purifiers, GST cutA PIL in the Delhi High Court seeks to classify air purifiers as medical devices under existing rules to reduce GST from 18% to 5%. The plea argues air purifiers are essential for health amid Delhi's severe air pollution and cannot be treated as luxury items.

Why some celebrity brands thrive while others fadeFrom Katrina Kaif's Kay Beauty to Kusha Kapila's Underneat, celebrity brands are no longer side projects. While some scale steadily and earn consumer trust, others struggle to outgrow launch buzz. What explains this divide?

ITR on hold? Tax department issues clarification on 'risk management' alertsThe tax department's latest clarification aims to ease taxpayer anxiety, stressing that the alerts are advisory and encourage voluntary correction. Refunds will resume once discrepancies are fixed or claims are verified as genuine.

A Pakistan-Bangladesh defence deal with eye on India? Buzz intensifiesPakistan-Bangladesh: In recent months, senior Pakistani military officials, including the ISI chief, have frequented Bangladesh. This has led to buzz that a defence deal is in the works. Pakistan is keen on signing the defence deal before the elections under a favourable Muhammad Yunus regime.

US scraps H-1B lottery system in visa overhaul. Who is at an advantage?The US Homeland Security will replace the H-1B visa lottery programme with a wage-weighted system from 2026, prioritising higher-paid and higher-skilled applicants while keeping visa caps unchanged to curb abuse and protect American workers.

Dhurandhar: Akshaye Khanna's brutal Rehman Dakait is also a sensitive loverAkshaye Khanna's Rehman Dakait in Dhurandhar is a ruthless villain drenched in blood and vengeance. But hidden beneath the gunshots and grief is a man with a quiet love story that makes him remarkable.

Indian-origin woman murdered in Toronto, suspect believed to be her partnerHimanshi Khurana, a 30-year-old Indian-origin woman, was found murdered in Toronto. Police suspect intimate partner violence and have issued a nationwide arrest warrant for a man identified as Abdul Ghafoori.

Explain conduct: Pilot faces Air India Express heat over alleged flyer assaultExternal inquiry committee will be constituted this week to probe the incident and examine the allegations against the pilot, sources told India Today. The pilot is accused of assaulting SpiceJet passenger Ankit Dewan during an altercation at the airport on December 19.

45 review: An entertaining blend between metaphysical and physical worldsRelease Date:Thu Dec 25, 202545 movie review: This blend of worlds is entertaining and thought-provoking, but whether it gets too indulgent in what it is trying to say remains an afterthought in this multi-starrer Kannada film, 45, featuring Raj B Shetty caught between Shiva Rajkumar and Upendra.

Rare snowfall in Saudi deserts: Why it's a big warning for IndiaThe snowfall in the desert signalled to the world that something fundamental is shifting in the planet's climate system, and the consequences are visible.

LIVE: Bahubali rocket LVM3 deploys satellite, PM Modi praises IsroISRO's LVM3-M6 Rocket, BlueBird-6 Satellite Live Updates: Isro launched the Bluebird Block-2 communication satellite aboard its heavy-lift LVM3-M6 rocket from Sriharikota at 8.54 am on December 24. Weighing about 6,100 kg, it will be the heaviest payload ever placed in low Earth orbit by the LVM3. The historic mission, under a commercial deal between Isro's arm NewSpace India Ltd and US firm AST SpaceMobile, aims to deploy a next-generation satellite providing high-speed cellular broadband directly to smartphones across the globe. Stay with IndiaToday.in for latest updates.

Yunus working personally to mend India ties: Bangladesh leader offers olive branchBangladesh's finance adviser Salehuddin Ahmed moved for reconciliation as ties between Delhi and Dhaka seemed to be in a free fall. He said that the head of the interim administration, Muhammad Yunus, was personally working to mend India-Bangladesh ties.

Leave Vaibhav Suryavanshi alone. Moral policing a 15-year-old helps no oneMoral policing a 15-year-old won't build champions. Patience might. Vaibhav Suryavanshi's mistake was human. Our reaction was not.

IFS officer issues warning after red fox spotted in Ladakh's Pangong lakeThe video shared by Instagram user Vibhor Srivastava showing a red fox roaming near Pangong Tso in Ladakh has gone viral. IFS officer Parveen Kaswan has shared an advisory regarding it.

Odisha under fire after buying Rs 12-crore modified Thars for forest rangersThe Odisha Forest Department's procurement and costly modification of the Thar SUVs has sparked widespread criticism, prompting an official audit to review the spending and approval process for these expenditures.

Delhi AQI improves to very poor; capital to get colder from tomorrowDelhi and its adjoining regions recorded an improvement in air quality, with the AQI entering in the very poor category on Wednesday morning. Smog appeared to have cleared up marginally, day after Delhi and Noida emerged as India's top two most polluted cities.

Viral videos appear to show England players drunk in Australia amid Ashes nightmareUnverified videos of Ben Duckett and Jacob Bethell's off-field conduct in Noosa have put England under fresh scrutiny, compounding an Ashes campaign that unravelled on and off the field after a 3-0 drubbing by Australia.

Why is Saudi Arabia witnessing rare snowfall? Science explainedThe unusual episode once again underlined how climate change is harbouring unusual weather in regions that are far from prepared to handle it.

Jamia suspends professor, to lodge FIR over exam question on Muslim atrocitiesJamia Millia Islamia, a central university, has reportedly suspended a professor of the department of social work over a controversial question in an end-semester exam. The 15-mark question sought a discussion on "atrocities on Muslim minorities in India" with examples. Jamia has said it will file an FIR as per rules.

Joke's on India: Vijay Mallya, Lalit Modi party, laugh about their fugitive statusA new video shows Lalit Modi mockingly calling himself and Vijay Mallya India's "biggest fugitives," a brazen dig at the government and a flaunting display of camaraderie with the fugitive businessman.

Kerala civic body builds Christmas tree from beer bottles, Congress objectsThe Congress-led UDF protested a Christmas tree made of empty beer bottles installed by the LDF-ruled Guruvayur Municipality in Kerala's Thrissur district.

sports.headline: Venus Williams marries actor Andrea Preti, sister Serena has a sweet message Venus Williams married Italian actor Andrea Preti in a private ceremony. Serena Williams shared an emotional tribute celebrating their lifelong bond and Venus's new chapter.

Manchester City closing in on Antoine Semenyo deal after United snub: Reports Antoine Semenyo's January future is quickly becoming one of the Premier League's biggest talking points. With Manchester City in pole position, Bournemouth now face a race against the release-clause clock.

Mohammad Kaif slams BCCI for Gill blunder: Indian cricket has gone behind Mohammad Kaif has criticised the Indian selectors for their move regarding Shubman Gill and the T20I side. He said that Indian cricket has gone behind due to their lack of planning.

Ishan Kishan is back, but is team India ready to trust him long-term? Ishan Kishan has returned to team India after two years of silence. After taking a break for personal reasons in December 2023, he also lost his central contract. During this period, he continued to perform consistently in domestic cricket and stormed his way back into the team.

Leave Vaibhav Suryavanshi alone. Moral policing a 15-year-old helps no one Moral policing a 15-year-old won't build champions. Patience might. Vaibhav Suryavanshi's mistake was human. Our reaction was not.

Rob Key backs Brendon McCullum despite England's Ashes horror in Australia Rob Key closed ranks around Brendon McCullum after England's Ashes collapse in Australia. Admitting failures in preparation and execution, England's leadership now face a decisive moment to evolve their approach.

Sports news today Live: Ro-Ko in Vijay Hazare Trophy action Today's Sports News Live Updates: From Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Vijay Hazare return, to Arsenal clinching a nail-biting win on penalties against Crystal Palace in the Carabao Cup, here's all that is happening in the sports world today.

Kepa becomes Arsenal's penalty hero in Carabao Cup thriller vs Crystal Palace Kepa Arrizabalaga delivered when pressure peaked, sealing Arsenal's Carabao Cup semi-final spot. As the season gathers momentum, Mikel Arteta's side continue to prove their depth and belief across competitions.

Virat Kohli returns to VHT: What was the cricket world like before his last match? Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are set to make their return in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Rohit will be playing in the tournament for the first time since 2018, while Kohli marks his comeback after a 15-year hiatus.

Rohit-Kohli take centre stage, but stories aplenty in Round 1 The Vijay Hazare Trophy begins on December 24, Wednesday. On Christmas Eve there are many storylines that will keep the fans hooked to the competition. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma will take centre stage but keep an eye out on others as well. Here is the preview of the Round 1 fixtures.

Security steps in as fans hound Rohit Sharma for selfies in Jaipur Rohit Sharma is in Jaipur to play Vijay Hazare Trophy. Fans thronged to the batter to click selfies after Rohit's net session at the Sawai Man Singh Stadium. One of them misbehaved and was swiftly removed by the security.

No Williamson vs Kohli as New Zealand announce white ball squads for India tourIndia vs New Zealand: The Blackcaps announced their white ball squads for the series against India. Senior batter Kane Williamson is set to skip the series, while top players return for the T20I leg ahead of the World Cup.

Shafali Verma blitz crushes Sri Lanka in Vizag, fires India Women to 2-0 series leadIND vs SL, 2nd Women's T20I: Shafali Verma's unbeaten 69 powered India to a commanding seven-wicket victory on Tuesday, as they chased down 129 with 49 balls to spare to take a 2-0 series lead.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma return to Vijay Hazare. But can you watch them live?Vijay Hazare: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma return to domestic cricket on Christmas Eve. Can you watch them play on broadcast or livestream their matches?

Odisha wrestlers' train ordeal: Why no athlete quota in railways, asks ex-OlympianEighteen young wrestlers from Odisha were forced to sit beside a toilet in a train compartment while travelling for a national championship. The incident has sparked outrage and raised urgent questions about sports planning and athlete support in the state.

Viral videos appear to show England players drunk in Australia amid Ashes nightmareUnverified videos of Ben Duckett and Jacob Bethell's off-field conduct in Noosa have put England under fresh scrutiny, compounding an Ashes campaign that unravelled on and off the field after a 3-0 drubbing by Australia.

Ricky Ponting explains how Harry Brook's mistakes cost England the AshesFormer Australia captain Ricky Ponting has criticised Harry Brook's approach during the Ashes, pointing to the England batter's costly mistakes as a key factor behind England's 3-0 series defeat to Australia.

No Kohli at Chinnaswamy: Govt body denies permission for Vijay Hazare matchVijay Hazare Trophy: The M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru has once again been denied permission to host key matches. The match between Delhi and Gujarat, where Virat Kohli was set to play, has been shifted to the BCCI's Centre of Excellence.

Ravindra Jadeja signals World Cup intent with Vijay Hazare Trophy availabilitySenior India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has confirmed he will play two matches for Saurashtra in the 2025–26 Vijay Hazare Trophy, as he looks to stay in contention for a place in India's squad for the 2027 ODI World Cup.

Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant begin training ahead of Delhi's Vijay Hazare Trophy openerVirat Kohli and Rishabh Pant led the way for Delhi as they got their training underway in Bengaluru ahead of the Vijay Hazare Trophy opening fixture set to be played on November 24.

Odisha Minister Nityananda Gond Orders Probe After 18 Wrestlers Forced to Travel Near Train ToiletsIn a shocking incident, 18 young athletes from Odisha were forced to travel near train toilets to the 69th National School Wrestling Championship in Uttar Pradesh due to unconfirmed tickets. The group, comprising 10 boys and 8 girls, endured freezing cold conditions without basic amenities. Responding to the outrage, Odisha School and Mass Education Minister Nityananda Gond stated, 'The government will examine the truth behind the allegations. After the inquiry, necessary action will be taken.' India Today's Anirban Sinha Roy reports on the ordeal that has sparked widespread condemnation.

World Cup hero Jemimah Rodrigues named Delhi Capitals captain for WPL 2026WPL 2026: Jemimah Rodrigues replaced Meg Lanning as Delhi Capitals' skipper for the upcoming edition of the tournament. The right-hander has featured in all three seasons for DC and was in sublime form during the Women's World Cup earlier this year.

2nd WT20I Highlights: Shafali storm leaves Sri Lanka clueless, India win by 7 wicketsIndia Women vs Sri Lanka Women 2nd T20I Highlights: India outclass Sri Lanka with a dominant all-round display, racing to 128 in just 11.5 overs after a strong bowling effort to clinch a seven-wicket win and a commanding 2–0 series lead.

Liverpool's Alexander Isak sidelined for two months, Arne Slot confirmsLiverpool's Alexander Isak faces a lengthy spell on the sidelines following a broken ankle and fibula sustained during a Premier League clash with Tottenham. The incident, described as reckless by coach Arne Slot, comes as a major setback for both the player and club.

No dignity: Odisha govt on the mat as wrestlers forced to sit near train toiletsA video of young Odisha wrestlers travelling for their national championships in the extremely inhumane conditions went viral on Tuesday. After the incident came in the public eye, state minister of school and mass education - Nityananda Gond promised an enquiry.

PM Modi hosts Neeraj Chopra and wife Himani Mor, discusses sports and morePrime Minister Narendra Modi met Neeraj Chopra and his wife Himani Mor at his residence in New Delhi. The meeting highlighted Neeraj's rise from a novice to a world-class javelin thrower and inspired many across India.

Pakistan to notify ICC on India's provocative behaviour in U19 Asia Cup final: ReportPakistan plans to approach the ICC over alleged on-field provocation by Indian players during the Under-19 Asia Cup final.

Messi's sister hospitalised after Miami car crash, wedding postponedLionel Messi's sister, Maria Sol Messi, has been hospitalised after being involved in a serious car crash in Miami, and her wedding planned for early January has been postponed as a result.

Ashwin dissects Stokes' major weakness: Can't play spin same way as fast bowlingRavichandran Ashwin criticised Ben Stokes' technique against spin after England's Ashes defeat in Adelaide. Stokes got bowled out for 5 in the second innings in Adelaide.

Deepti Sharma becomes No. 1 T20I bowler, Smriti Mandhana slips to No.2India all-rounder Deepti Sharma has climbed to No.1 in the ICC T20I bowling rankings after her spell against Sri Lanka. At the same time, Smriti Mandhana has slipped to second in the ODI batting list as South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt reclaimed the top spot.

Sunil Gavaskar first Indian sportsperson to secure personality rights protectionSunil Gavaskar is the first Indian sportsperson to receive court-backed protection for his personality rights. This landmark ruling sets a precedent for athletes seeking legal control over digital misuse of their identity.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
